Package server.RMIHandler

Class ServerControllerRMI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
      • java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
        • java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
          • server.RMIHandler.ServerControllerRMI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InterfaceServerControllerRMI, java.io.Serializable, java.rmi.Remote
    public class ServerControllerRMI
extends java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
implements InterfaceServerControllerRMI
    This is the class that generates the remote object, called by the client! This object contains the implementation of the InterfaceServerControllerRMI Contains all the client exposed methods that can be called remotely and some more
    Author:
    edoardorealini, MADSOMMA, GioValca
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      ServerControllerRMI​(MatchController matchController)
      Constructor, creates a new remote controller given the match controller (sub layer)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void askForPowerUpAsAmmo()
      This method is used by the server to ask the players to use a powerUp ad Ammo
      void askForTagBackGrenade​(java.lang.String nickname)
      With this method you can ask to a specific client to use the tagback grenade
      void askRespawn()
      This method asks all the players in status spawn or respawn to respawn Basically acrivates a pop up on the GUI asking to discard a powerUp
      void buildMap​(int mapID, int clientHashedID)
      This method when called asks the match controller do build the map of the specific ID
      boolean checkIfConnected​(java.lang.String nickname)
      This method is used to check the connection on a specific player in This server
      void closeTimer​(java.lang.String timerName, int clientHashedID)
      closes the timer of speficied name
      int connectedPlayers()
      This method returns the number of connected players to this match
      void createRanking()
      creates the final ranking and displays it to the players
      void disconnectPlayer​(int clientHashedID)
      This method is called whenever a client has to disconnect
      boolean getMatchStatus()
      This method gets the status of the match, that can be either true = active or false = not active
      java.util.ArrayList<Player> getPlayers()
      This method returns a list of all the registered players to a match
      PlayerStatusHandler getPlayerStatus​(int idPlayer)
      This method is used to get the status of a specific player, passed in input as his id
      void grabAmmoCard​(int xDestination, int yDestination, int clientHashedID)
      This method is called by a client when a player wants to grab an ammo card from a specific location
      void grabWeapon​(int xDestination, int yDestination, int indexOfWeapon, int clientHashedID, int indexOfWeaponToSwap)
      This method is called by a client when he wants to grab a weapon froma specific location
      void makeAction1Frenzy​(int posX, int posY, ShootingParametersClient input, int clientHashedID)
      This method is used by a player when he wants to perform a franzy action.
      void makeAction1FrenzyLower​(int posX, int posY, ShootingParametersClient input, int clientHashedID)
      This method is used to make the action Shoot but with 2 moves (action1 frenzy allows to make 1 move)
      void makeAction2Frenzy​(int posX, int posY, int clientHashedID)
      This method embodies the controls and actions to realize the second action in frenzy mode.
      void makeAction2FrenzyLower​(int posX, int posY, int numbOfWeaponToGrab, int clientHashedID, int indexOfWeaponToSwap)
      With this method you can perform the grab with 3 of maximum distance of move
      void makeAction3Frenzy​(int posX, int posY, int numbOfWeaponToGrab, int clientHashedID, int indexOfWeaponToSwap)
      This method allows you to make the action where you move up to 2 squares and the grab
      void move​(int iDestination, int jDestination, int clientHashedID)
      This method is called when a player wants to make a move in the game It delegates to matchController the actual move
      void ping()
      PING !
      void pushMatchToAllPlayers()
      This method is used whenever the server has to notify the clints any changes in the game.

      With register a client can register on this specific controller (and match)
      void reload​(int indexOfWeapon, int clientHashedID)
      This method is called whenever a client has to reload his weapons (if allowed to)
      void setSkulls​(int nSkulls, int clientHashedID)
      This method sets the number of remaining skulls in the mortal path
      void shoot​(ShootingParametersClient input, int clientHashedID)
      This method is used whenever a user wants to make the shoot action in the game
      void skipAction​(int clientHashedID)
      This method is called by an active client when he wants to skip an action
      void skipActionFrenzy​(int clientHashedID)
      This method is similar to skipAction but it's used during the frenzy mode, has different paramenters on status controls
      void spawn​(int powerUpID, int clientHashedID)
      this method is called from a client whenever he has to spawn

      useNewton is called when a newton powerUp has to be used
      void usePowerUpAsAmmo​(int indexOfPow)
      This method is used whenever a player has to pay a cost with a powerUp

      useTeleporter is called when a teleporter powerUp has to be used

      • register

        public int register​(InterfaceClientControllerRMI clientController,
                    java.lang.String nickname)
             throws javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException
        With register a client can register on this specific controller (and match)
        Specified by:
        register in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        clientController - the clientController is the remoteController of the client side (a remote object)
        nickname - the nickname that the user wants to use to play
        Returns:
        returns the clientHashedID that the client uses to identify himself when calling the server
        Throws:
        javax.security.auth.login.FailedLoginException - when the nickname is already in use or there is an error during the hash phase

      • buildMap

        public void buildMap​(int mapID,
                     int clientHashedID)
              throws NotAllowedCallException,
                     WrongValueException,
                     WrongStatusException,
                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method when called asks the match controller do build the map of the specific ID
        Specified by:
        buildMap in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        mapID - the id of the map to build
        clientHashedID - identifies the client
        Throws:
        NotAllowedCallException - when the player making the call is not allowed to (he is not the current player)
        WrongValueException - an invalid id is given
        WrongStatusException - the player is in a not allowed status (!= MASTER)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - network error

                throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method asks all the players in status spawn or respawn to respawn Basically acrivates a pop up on the GUI asking to discard a powerUp
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error

      • spawn

        public void spawn​(int powerUpID,
                  int clientHashedID)
           throws NotInYourPossessException,
                  WrongStatusException,
                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        this method is called from a client whenever he has to spawn
        Specified by:
        spawn in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        powerUpID - id of the powerUp to discard (integer, order of powerUp in hand)
        clientHashedID - identifies the client as usual
        Throws:
        NotInYourPossessException - if the player does not have the chosen powerUp
        WrongStatusException - if the player asks to spawn when he is not in status spawn or respawn
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error

      • move

        public void move​(int iDestination,
                 int jDestination,
                 int clientHashedID)
          throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                 java.rmi.RemoteException,
                 InvalidInputException,
                 WrongStatusException,
                 NotAllowedCallException
        This method is called when a player wants to make a move in the game It delegates to matchController the actual move
        Specified by:
        move in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        iDestination - x coordinate of the square to move in
        jDestination - y coordinate of the square to move in
        clientHashedID - identifies the client univocally
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move exceeds the maximum distance allowed
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        InvalidInputException - if the given indexes are not acceptable values
        WrongStatusException - if the player is in the wrong status to make the move, he has to be either in FIRST_ACTION or SECOND_ACTION
        NotAllowedCallException - if the client hashed id is non the same as the current player

      • grabAmmoCard

        public void grabAmmoCard​(int xDestination,
                         int yDestination,
                         int clientHashedID)
                  throws WrongStatusException,
                         WrongPositionException,
                         NotAllowedCallException,
                         java.rmi.RemoteException,
                         InvalidInputException,
                         NotAllowedMoveException
        This method is called by a client when a player wants to grab an ammo card from a specific location
        Specified by:
        grabAmmoCard in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        xDestination - x coordinate of the wanted position
        yDestination - y coordinate of the wanted position
        clientHashedID - identifies the client making the call
        Throws:
        WrongStatusException - if the player is in the wrong status to make this call
        WrongPositionException - if the player cannot access to the given position to grab
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not allowed to (not current player)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        InvalidInputException - if the coordinates are not allowed valued (e.g negative values)
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move that has to be made to grab is not allowed

      • grabWeapon

        public void grabWeapon​(int xDestination,
                       int yDestination,
                       int indexOfWeapon,
                       int clientHashedID,
                       int indexOfWeaponToSwap)
                throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                       InvalidInputException,
                       WrongPositionException,
                       NotEnoughAmmoException,
                       WrongStatusException,
                       NotAllowedCallException,
                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        This method is called by a client when he wants to grab a weapon froma specific location
        Specified by:
        grabWeapon in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        xDestination - x coordinate of the wanted position
        yDestination - y coordinate of the wanted position
        clientHashedID - identifies the client making the call
        indexOfWeapon - index of the weapon on the weaponBox
        indexOfWeaponToSwap - index of the weapon in hand to swap
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move that has to be made to grab is not allowed
        InvalidInputException - if the coordinates are not allowed valued (e.g negative values)
        WrongPositionException - if the player cannot access to the given position to grab
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player cannot pay the ammo to grab the specific weapon
        WrongStatusException - if the player is in the wrong status to make this call
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not allowed to (not current player)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error

      • useTeleporter

        public void useTeleporter​(int indexOfPowerUp,
                          int xDest,
                          int yDest,
                          int clientHashedID)
                   throws NotInYourPossessException,
                          WrongStatusException,
                          java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          NotAllowedCallException,
                          NotAllowedMoveException,
                          WrongPowerUpException,
                          InvalidInputException
        useTeleporter is called when a teleporter powerUp has to be used
        Specified by:
        useTeleporter in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        indexOfPowerUp - index of the powerUp in hand
        xDest - x coordinate of destination
        yDest - y coordinate of destination
        clientHashedID - id to identify caller
        Throws:
        NotInYourPossessException - if the player doesn't have the powerUp in hand
        WrongStatusException - if the player hasn't access to the use of powerUps
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player identified by the clientHashedID is not the current player
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move is not allowed
        WrongPowerUpException - if the powerUp is not a Teleporter
        InvalidInputException - if the coordinates are wrong or the index is not valid

        public void useNewton​(int indexOfPowerUp,
                      java.lang.String affectedPlayer,
                      int xDest,
                      int yDest,
                      int clientHashedID)
               throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                      NotAllowedCallException,
                      NotInYourPossessException,
                      WrongStatusException,
                      java.rmi.RemoteException,
                      WrongValueException,
                      InvalidInputException,
                      WrongPowerUpException
        useNewton is called when a newton powerUp has to be used
        Specified by:
        useNewton in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        indexOfPowerUp - index of the powerUp in hand
        xDest - x coordinate of destination
        yDest - y coordinate of destination
        clientHashedID - id to identify caller
        affectedPlayer - the player to move with the Newton effect
        Throws:
        NotInYourPossessException - if the player doesn't have the powerUp in hand
        WrongStatusException - if the player hasn't access to the use of powerUps
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player identified by the clientHashedID is not the current player
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move is not allowed
        WrongPowerUpException - if the powerUp is not a Newton
        InvalidInputException - if the coordinates are wrong or the index is not valid
        WrongValueException - wrong values

      • useTargetingScope

        public void useTargetingScope​(int indexOfTargetingScope,
                              java.lang.String affectedPlayer,
                              int clientHashedID,
                              Color ammoColorToPay)
                       throws NotAllowedCallException,
                              NotInYourPossessException,
                              WrongStatusException,
                              java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              NotEnoughAmmoException
        This method is used when a Player wats to use a TargetingScope
        Specified by:
        useTargetingScope in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        indexOfTargetingScope - index of the powerUp in hand
        affectedPlayer - player to accect with the effect of the targeting scope
        clientHashedID - identifies the client making the call
        ammoColorToPay - needed to verify if can pay the ammo requested
        Throws:
        NotAllowedCallException - when the client hashed id is not the current player
        NotInYourPossessException - if the player making the call does not have the powerUp in hand
        WrongStatusException - inf the player has no rights to use the powerUp targeting scope
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player cannot pay for the effect

        affectedPlayer - the player to affect with the powerUp

        Throws:

        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error

      • shoot

        public void shoot​(ShootingParametersClient input,
                  int clientHashedID)
           throws NotAllowedCallException,
                  NotAllowedTargetException,
                  NotAllowedMoveException,
                  WrongStatusException,
                  NotEnoughAmmoException,
                  NotAllowedShootingModeException,
                  java.rmi.RemoteException,
                  InvalidInputException
        This method is used whenever a user wants to make the shoot action in the game
        Specified by:
        shoot in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        input - contains all the input paramenters required to make a shooting action
        clientHashedID - identifes the player making the request
        Throws:
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player is non identifued correctly (wrong hashed id)
        NotAllowedTargetException - if the targets are setted wrongly
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the requested move in the action of shooting is not allowed
        WrongStatusException - if the player cannot make the action, is in the wrong status
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player does not have enough ammo to shoot
        NotAllowedShootingModeException - if the shooting mode requested is wrongly setted
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        InvalidInputException - if there is an error in the input parameters

      • reload

        public void reload​(int indexOfWeapon,
                   int clientHashedID)
            throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                   NotEnoughAmmoException,
                   NotAllowedCallException,
                   WrongStatusException
        This method is called whenever a client has to reload his weapons (if allowed to)
        Specified by:
        reload in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        indexOfWeapon - index of weapon in hand to reload
        clientHashedID - allows the server to identify the client making the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the ammo of the player is not enough to reload the weapon
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player is not allowed to make the call (not the current player)
        WrongStatusException - if the player ha no rights to make such call

        This method is used whenever the server has to notify the clints any changes in the game. For example when a player changes position, is hitted or makes an action.

        java.rmi.RemoteException - on newtork erros contacting the clients

      • makeAction1Frenzy

        public void makeAction1Frenzy​(int posX,
                              int posY,
                              ShootingParametersClient input,
                              int clientHashedID)
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              NotAllowedTargetException,
                              NotAllowedShootingModeException,
                              InvalidInputException,
                              WrongStatusException,
                              NotAllowedMoveException,
                              NotEnoughAmmoException,
                              NotAllowedCallException
        This method is used by a player when he wants to perform a franzy action. In particular this method creates the Move + Reload + Shoot action
        Specified by:
        makeAction1Frenzy in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of destination square
        posY - y coordinate of destination square
        input - contains all the shooting inputs
        clientHashedID - identifies the client when making the call
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedTargetException - if the specified target(s) in shoot are not allowed (see rules)
        NotAllowedShootingModeException - if the shooting mode is not available for the chosen weapon
        InvalidInputException - if the input paramenter has a general error
        WrongStatusException - if the player making the call is not in First of Second action Frenzy mode
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the requested move is not allowed (see rules)
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player has not enough ammo to reload or use his weapon
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not the current player

      • makeAction1FrenzyLower

                                   int posY,
                                   ShootingParametersClient input,
                                   int clientHashedID)
                            throws NotAllowedTargetException,

                                   NotAllowedMoveException,
                                   NotEnoughAmmoException,
                                   java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                   NotAllowedCallException
        This method is used to make the action Shoot but with 2 moves (action1 frenzy allows to make 1 move)
        Specified by:
        makeAction1FrenzyLower in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of destination
        posY - y coordinate of destination
        input - input of shoot action
        clientHashedID - identifies the player making the call
        Throws:
        NotAllowedTargetException - if the specified target(s) in shoot are not allowed (see rules)
        NotAllowedShootingModeException - if the shooting mode is not available for the chosen weapon
        InvalidInputException - if the input paramenter has a general error
        WrongStatusException - if the player making the call is not in First of Second action Frenzy mode
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the requested move is not allowed (see rules)
        NotEnoughAmmoException - if the player has not enough ammo to reload or use his weapon
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not the current player

      • makeAction2Frenzy

        public void makeAction2Frenzy​(int posX,
                              int posY,
                              int clientHashedID)
                       throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                              java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              NotAllowedCallException,
                              WrongStatusException
        This method embodies the controls and actions to realize the second action in frenzy mode. With second action has to be intended that with this method you can make the move up to 4 squares!
        Specified by:
        makeAction2Frenzy in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of destination square
        posY - y coordinate of sqaure
        clientHashedID - identifies the client making the call
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the requested move exceeds the maximum distance (4)
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not the current player
        WrongStatusException - if the player making the call is in the wrong status

      • makeAction3Frenzy

        public void makeAction3Frenzy​(int posX,
                              int posY,
                              int numbOfWeaponToGrab,
                              int clientHashedID,
                              int indexOfWeaponToSwap)
                       throws NotAllowedMoveException,
                              java.rmi.RemoteException,
                              NotAllowedCallException,
                              WrongStatusException
        This method allows you to make the action where you move up to 2 squares and the grab
        Specified by:
        makeAction3Frenzy in interface InterfaceServerControllerRMI
        Parameters:
        posX - x coordinate of destination
        posY - y coordinate of destination
        numbOfWeaponToGrab - index of weapon to grab in map
        clientHashedID - identifies the player making the call
        indexOfWeaponToSwap - index of weapon in hand to swap with picked one
        Throws:
        NotAllowedMoveException - if the move exceeds 2 squares distance
        java.rmi.RemoteException - on network error
        NotAllowedCallException - if the player making the call is not the current player
        WrongStatusException - if the player is in the wrong status of his turn
